intro: Mammillaria missouriensis var. nuttallii, commonly known as the Missouri milk barrel cactus, is a compact, globular cactus native to the central United States. It features a dense covering of white to pale blue spines and small, tubular flowers that bloom in shades of yellow to orange. The plant typically grows to a height of 5–10 centimeters and has a rounded, segmented stem. It is well adapted to arid environments and requires minimal water, making it suitable for rock gardens or containers. Its unique appearance and hardy nature make it a popular choice among succulent enthusiasts.
